c74object.name: the.jit.gl.sah
c74object.digest: Sample and hold a texture according to a trigger
c74object.description:
Written by Tim Heinze Â© 2021, www.xenorama.com.
Use the.jit.gl.sah to capture ("sample") and continually output ("hold") the value of an input texture whenever another "control" texture rises above a specified threshold value. The sampled pixel is "held" until the control signal drops below and then rises above the threshold value once more, at which point the input is sampled again. Generally this allows one texture to be synchronized to the behavior of another.

objarg.name: threshold
objarg.description:
Initial trigger value (normalized threshold). A value between 0. and 1. determines which pixel value needs to be exceeded by the control texture.
the default is 0.5 and can be overriden by the thresh attribute

attribute.name: thresh
attribute.description:
Initial trigger value (normalized threshold). A value between 0. and 1. determines which pixel value needs to be exceeded by the control texture.
the default is 0.5

attribute.name: freeze
attribute.description: Hold incomnig texture (default: 1). When set to ("0") the specified trigger value of thresh does not have to be retriggered by the control pixel but will keep the incoming texture running while it is above the threshold.

attribute.name: lum
attribute.description: Use luminance of control texture (default: 0). When set to ("1"), the control texture is used as a black-and-white luminance map for trigger values and will thus not produce rgb-shifting effects but handle all color-planes evenly.

method.name: float
method.digest: Set control value for all pixels
method.description: In right inlet: Set control value for all pixels overriding any previous jit_gl_texture

method.name: bang
method.description: Reset any held texture and start sampling anew.
